name: Avoid placing PeopleCode into Fields, prefer Component Level (PeopleSoft)
description:
This quality rule reports RecordField Event referencing the system variable %Component or %CompIntfcName.
The latter returns the name of the Component Interface, if the currently executing PeopleCode program is being run from a Component Interface.
This is a sign the code need to be moved to the parent Component.
rationale:
Restrict the use of RecordField level PeopleCode as it hinders on-line performance.

Also, for question of code organization and hence maintenance, it is better to manage the events centrally, at the Component Level.
It avoids to jump from one place to another.
reference:
Efficiency:  TOBE.
Maintainance: Effectively Organizing your PeopleCode: https://www.cedarhillsgroup.com/knowledge-base/kbarticles/effectively-organizing-your-peoplecode/
remediation: Move the Peoplecode from RecordField level to parent Component level.
alternativeName: Avoid placing PeopleCode into Fields, prefer Component Level (PeopleSoft)
